original_title: CSE sets up yet another record as ASPI hits 21,000 index points
original_body_lines: The CSE set up another record yesterday when the All Share Price Index surpassed 21,000 Index points, market analysts said.
The reason for the high-point in trading was the low interest regime coupled with conducive economic policies which enabled the market to grow, analysts explained.
Amid those developments indices gave out mixed signals. The All Share Price Index went up by 52.3 points while the S and P SL20 declined by 4.07 points.

Turnover stood at Rs 13.2 billion with eleven crossings. The main crossings were reported in JKH, which crossed 331 million shares to the tune of Rs 5.38 billion; its shares traded at Rs 23, Commercial Bank 7.1 million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 1.4 billion; its shares traded at Rs 193, CT Holdings 500,000 shares crossed for Rs 351 million; its shares sold at Rs 702, Dialog Axiata 3.6 million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 95 million; its shares traded at Rs 93, VallibelOne one million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 93 million; its shares traded at Rs 93.

Asian Hotel Properties one million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 70 million; its shares traded at Rs 70, Hemas Holdings 2.1 million shares crossed for Rs 64 million and its shares sold at Rs 30.50, Lanka IOC 300,000 shares crossed to the tune of Rs 40.5 million; its shares traded at Rs 135, Haylays 175,000 shares crossed for Rs 30.6 million; its shares fetched Rs 135.

In the retail market top seven companies that have mainly contributed to the turnover were; Prime Lands Residencies Rs 484 million (18 million shares traded), RIL Properties Rs 268 million (8.8 million shares traded), Sierra Cables Rs 253 million (10.3 million shares traded), Lanka Milk Food Rs 234 million (3.9 million shares traded), Waskaduwa Beach Resort Rs 155 million (68 million shares traded), Commercial Credit Rs 148 million (one million shares traded) and JKH Rs 147 million (6.4 million shares traded). During the day 534 million shares volumes changed hands in 48000 transactions.
Yesterday, the rupee was quoted flat at Rs 302.00/10 to the US dollar in the spot market , same as Friday’s close, while bond yields were quoted higher, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2026 was quoted flat at 8.15/25 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 8.60/70 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2028 was quoted at 8.95/9.00 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2029 was quoted at 9.45/55 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2032 was quoted flat at 10.30/40 percent.
